properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will run after the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Wests Tigers at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. NRL kick-off from 6pm. Full-time around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium in the busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

NRL: Rabbitohs v Roosters @ ACCOR Stadium, Sydney Olympic Park. NRL kick-off from 8pm, finish approx 9:45pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd as crowds travel to and from the match during Friday evening peak.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event or until sold out

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Cowboys at BlueBet Stadium. NRL kick-off at 5:30pm, full time approx. 7:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Knights at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. NRL kick-off from 7:35pm and full time approx. 9:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW: Roosters v Eels at Industree Group Stadium in Gosford. Kick-off from 1:50pm, full time around 3:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.publicTransport: Additional trains will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Eureka Harness Race Day at Club Menangle Trackside. Start from 4:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the racecourse including Menangle Rd as crowds travel to and from the event. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

NRL: Sharks v Raiders at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full time around 6pm.

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

The Coastal Classic is a 30km trail run along the Australian East Coast and will be taking place partly on Lady Wakehurst Drive at Otford.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place at Fanshawe Rd to allow runners to cross the road.

properties.publicTransport: Plan you trip at transportnsw.info. Visit Night at the Barracks – Getting There for details on how to get to the precinct.
properties.otherAdvice:
Night at the Barracks is back on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights at The Barracks Precinct from 15 September to 7 October.

Traffic maybe heavier than usual on event nights as attendees travel to and from the shows.

Limited parking is available nearby St Pauls High School on event nights. Motorists must pre-book a space as no casual parking will be available on the night.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of extra pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRLW: Sharks v Dragons at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full time around 9:45pm.

Road closures may be put in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual in the busy Thursday evening peak, including on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

NRLW Double Header at McDonald Jones Stadium. Wests Tigers v Broncos from 11:30am, Knights v Roosters from 1:30pm. Full-time 3:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Culture Club at Aware Super Theatre, ICC Sydney. Show starts from 7:30pm, finishes around 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the show during the busy Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Waverley Council - Festival of the Winds

properties.publicTransport: Additional buses will run between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Over 40,000 people are expected to attend the annual Festival of the Winds at Bondi Beach from 11am to 4pm. Changed traffic conditions will be in place at Bondi Beach and Bondi Junction.

Traffic will be very heavy on approaches to Bondi including Bondi Rd, Syd Einfeld Dr, Old South Head Rd and Military Rd as well as local roads around Bondi Beach. Motorists are advised to avoid non-essential travel or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures

  • From 10am to 6pm: roads around Bondi Junction Interchange will be closed including sections of Grafton St, Grosvenor St, Oxford St and Grosvenor Lane. 
  • Access to the Queen Elizabeth Dr and Park Dr carparks will be managed under traffic control from 5am to 7pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 7pm on both sides of Bondi Rd between Old South Head Rd and Sandridge St, as well as sections of Campbell Pde, Hall St and Curlewis St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BONDI JUNCTION – FROM 10AM TO 6PM

  • Grafton Street between Grosvenor Street and Newland Street (westbound)
  • Grosvenor Street between Spring Street and Grafton Street (both directions)
  • Grosvenor Lane* between Newland Street and Grosvenor Street (eastbound)
  • Oxford Street between Adelaide Street and Grosvenor Street (both directions)

Note: *Resident access permitted.


MANAGED ACCESS - BONDI BEACH – FROM 5AM TO 7PM

Access will be managed at the following locations by traffic controllers, follow directions and allow extra time.

  • Park Drive Car Park between Roscoe Street and Queen Elizabeth Drive (both sides)
  • Queen Elizabeth Drive Car Park at Campbell Parade (northern access only)

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

BONDI / BONDI BEACH – FROM 7AM TO 7PM

arrangementElements.title: Road closures and Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Run to the Rose Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 11:50am, last race from 5:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from Canley Vale and Canley Heights to Cabramatta. Regular route buses will be diverting and missing stops while roads are closed. The bus interchange at Cabramatta Station will be temporarily relocated to Railway Pde, between McBurney Rd and Hughes St. Services will start and end their trips at temporary stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the annual Cabramatta Moon Festival held on John St from 11am to 8pm on Sunday.

Heavy traffic is expected on Joseph St, Railway Pde, Cumberland Hwy and Cabramatta Rd West as crowds travel to and from the event. 

Road closures

  • From 8pm on Saturday the night before, sections of John St, Cabramatta Rd West, Park Rd and Arthur St in the Cabramatta CBD will be closed until midnight on Sunday. Motorists will be detoured via local roads.
  • From 12:01am to 11:59pm on Sunday, Railway Parade and Dutton Lane will be closed.
  • Arthur St car park will close from 12am Friday until 12pm Monday, and Hughes St car park will be closed from 8pm Saturday until 12pm Monday.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included for participants. Major bus diversions will be in place, plan ahead at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in Milsons Point, the City, Darlinghurst, Moore Park and Pyrmont for the Sydney Marathon on Sunday 17 September. This year, the Sydney Marathon is an official candidate to become an Abbott World Marathon Major which requires changes to the event course; resulting in significant road closures and traffic impacts.

Sydney motorists are urged to avoid non-essential travel in areas around the course as long delays are expected with major detours in place.

The Harbour Bridge will close from 4am to 10am and major roads from the Opera House down to Moore Park will be closed until 2:30pm/3pm including Macquarie St, College St, Park St, Oxford St and Flinders St. Motorists will only be able to travel east/west across the course via the Cross City Tunnel which will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm on event day however long delays are expected and motorists should avoid non-essential travel.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 3:30am to 11am: roads at the start line in Milsons Point including Alfred St South.
  • 4am to 8:30am: roads in Millers Point and Barangaroo including sections of Watsons Rd, Upper Fort St and Argyle St.
  • 4am to 9:30am: roads in Pyrmont north including Bowman St and Pirrama Rd.
  • 4am to 10am: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Cahill Expressway, Western Distributor and some roads in Milsons Point and Pyrmont.
  • Southbound traffic approaching the Harbour Bridge will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel. Citybound traffic on the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via Bathurst St off-ramp. No direct access between the Anzac Bridge and Harbour Bridge until 10am. Motorists can use the Harbour Tunnel or Victoria Rd/Gladesville Bridge alternative routes.
  • Note: Access to the Harbour Tunnel from the west is via the Cross City Tunnel only, no access via the city while major roads are closed. Drivers west of the city needing to travel north prior to 10am should use Victoria Rd/Gladesville Bridge.
  • 4am to 10:30am: roads in Millers Point including Hickson Rd, Dalgety Rd and Towns Place.
  • 4am to 11am: roads in The Rocks and Dawes Point including Hickson Rd and George St.
  • 4am to 2pm: roads in Moore Park including Moore Park Rd, Driver Ave. Centennial Park will also be closed to vehicles. Eastern Distributor Bondi Exit to Moore Park Rd will close from 2am - 4am and from 1:15pm - 2pm.
  • 4am to 2:30pm: Park St, College St, Oxford St and Flinders St from the city, Darlinghurst through to Moore Park.
  • Motorists will only be able to travel across the course via the Cross City Tunnel which will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm on event day however long delays are expected and motorists should avoid non-essential travel.
  • 4am to 3pm: roads in Sydney CBD east including Macquarie St, Bridge St, College St and Art Gallery Rd.
  • 5:30am to 11am: roads in Sydney CBD north and Circular Quay including Bridge St, Pitt St, Loftus St and Young St.
  • 6:30am to 12pm: Southbound lanes of Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd at Moore Park. Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde exit will also be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 1am to 3pm on major roads in the city, Pyrmont and Moore Park and from 12:15am to 11am on roads in Milsons Point and North Sydney.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

*1 Lavender St remains open westbound to allow for residents to leave the area via Cliff St or Harbourview Cres. Paul St, Dind St, Glen St and Cliff St all closed at Alfred St South. Residents can exit from these roads only. No access allowed.

Sydney Harbour Bridge and Approaches

From 4am to 10am

  • Bradfield Hwy / Sydney Harbour Bridge*2 all northbound and southbound lanes
  • Cahill Expressway between Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Domain Tunnel
  • Pacific Hwy between Bradfield Hwy and High St northbound

Notes:

*2 The Sydney Harbour Tunnel will remain open in both directions during the event except for use by oversize vehicles or vehicles carrying dangerous goods. These vehicles will be detoured via the Gladesville Bridge and ANZAC Bridge when the Sydney Harbour Bridge is closed. There is no direct access to the CBD via Eastern Distributor exits at Cowper Bay Wharf or Kings Cross exits throughout the day, drivers will need to use the Cross City Tunnel via William St

*3 The ANZAC Bridge will remain open in both directions during the event with the Western Distributor / Bathurst St exit ramp available to provide access to the western side of Sydney CBD and the Cross City Tunnel for access to the eastern suburbs and Sydney Harbour Tunnel. There is no direct access through the CBD for the eastern suburbs or Harbour Tunnel between 5am and 2pm.

*9 Erskine St will be closed between Shelley St and Sussex St from 5:00am to 8:30am. During this time access to and from King St Wharf area will be via Wheat Rd between 5:00am and 8:30am. From 8:30am vehicles exiting the area will be via Erskine Street

*7 Local access from Albert St, Loftus Ln, Phillip Ln, the Intercontinental Hotel, the Sir Stamford Hotel and Quay Grand Suites will be via traffic control at Bridge St and Phillip St between 5:30am and 7am and 10:30am and 11am. There will be no access from 7am to 10:30am. Directions to vehicles will be via Police & traffic controllers in the area.

Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Speed limit reductions

arrangementElements.html:
CIRCULAR QUAY

Road closures:

  • Macquarie St from the Opera House to Hyde Park will be closed from 4am - 3pm.  
  • Roads north of Bridge St including Pitt, Loftus, Young and Phillip Streets will be closed from 5:30am - 11am.

Managed access:

Sydney Opera House car park: No entry after 5am, exit only via Macquarie St, Albert St & Phillip St until 5:30am under Traffic Controller / NSW Police direction.

  • Managed EXIT will be permitted for vehicles from properties on Albert St and Phillip St. No entry permitted.
  • Exit via Phillip St at Bridge St southbound from 5:30am-7am and 10:30am-11am only.
  • NOTE: Runners on Bridge St from 7:30am – 10:15am 
  • Managed entry into Albert St from 11am – 3pm. No access into Macquarie St 

EASTERN SUBURBS

Major roads will be closed restricting access east/west across the course from the Opera House, through the city, Darlinghurst down to Moore Park.

Key roads will be closed between 4am and 2:30pm/3pm including:

  • Park St / William St between Elizabeth St and Crown St
  • Oxford St from Liverpool St to Flinders St
  • Flinders St from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd
  • College St between Macquarie St and Oxford St
  • Macquarie St from the Opera House to Hyde Park

For drivers needing to travel east/west across the course on event day during these hours, the only available route is via the Cross City Tunnel. The tunnel will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm. Long delays are expected so motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel, and if you do need to drive allow for plenty of extra travel time on the roads. Alternative detour to travel east/west across the course is around Centennial Park via York Rd and Alison Rd during closures.

MOORE PARK AND CENTENNIAL PARK

Major roads will be closed restricting access east/west across the course from the Opera House, through the city, Darlinghurst down to Moore Park.

Sections of Macquarie St, College St, Park St, Oxford St and Flinders St will be closed between 4am and 3pm.

For drivers needing to travel east/west across the course on event day during these hours, the only available route is via the Cross City Tunnel. The tunnel will be toll-free from 5am to 3pm. Long delays are expected so motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel, and if you do need to drive allow for plenty of extra travel time on the roads.

Alternative detour to travel east/west across the course is around Centennial Park via York Rd and Alison Rd during closures.

Road closures and local access

  • Centennial Park: from 4am to 2pm there will be no access for vehicles or cyclists, and no equestrian access. Only pedestrian access to the park will be permitted.
  • Entertainment Quarter: from 4:30am-1:30pm access to the precinct is via Lang Rd at Oxford St from the east. No access via Anzac Pde or Lang Rd at Cleveland St. Note: contingency closures may be implemented on Lang Rd at Oxford St – should this be closed access to the Entertainment Quarter will be via Oxford St, Oatley Rd, Moore Park Rd, and Cook Rd only.  
  • Eastern Distributor off-ramp closures Randwick and Bondi: The Randwick exit to Anzac Pde exit will be closed from 6:30am to 12pm, exit via Bondi during this time. The Bondi exit to Moore Park Rd will be closed from 2am to 4am and 1:15pm to 2pm. Use the Randwick Anzac Pde exit during these times.

Moore Park:

  • From 4am to 2pm Moore Park Rd will be closed westbound from Lang Rd to Anzac Pde including Driver Ave. Moore Park Rd remains open eastbound from Greens Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4am to 1:30pm Lang Rd closed at Anzac Pde Cleveland St. Vehicle crossover at Cleveland St and Lang Rd will remain open until 5am only.
  • From 6.30am – 12pm: Anzac Pde closed southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd. Note Anzac Pde from 12pm this section of Anzac Pde is only accessible via the Eastern Distributor due to closures on Flinders St until 2:30pm.
  • Robertson Rd properties: Residents in Robertson Rd, Martin Rd, Oxley Ln and Dibbs St have managed access/exit only during the below times. Residents can park in the Entertainment Quarter – the event will issue a reimbursement if conditions from the reimbursement form are met. 4:00am – 6:00am, 7:30am – 8:15am and 12:30pm – 1:30pm.

PYRMONT

The following key roads in Pyrmont and Darling Harbour will be closed:

  • From 4am to 9:30am: roads in the northern end of Pyrmont including Pirrama Rd, Bowman St, Refinery Dr and Darling Island Rd.
  • From 4am to 10am: roads in the southern end of Pyrmont and Darling Harbour including sections of Pyrmont St, Pirrama Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd and the Pyrmont on-ramp to the Western Distributor.
  • The Western Distributor between Pyrmont and the CBD including on/off ramps will be closed from 4am to 10am. Citybound traffic from the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via the Bathurst St off ramp.
  • Access to areas north of the Harbour Bridge: from 4am to 10am motorists travelling north of the Harbour Bridge will need to travel via the Cross City Tunnel eastbound towards Kings Cross (toll-free from 5am – 3pm) and join the Eastern Distributor via the Bayswater Rd entry portal to continue on the Harbour Tunnel northbound. Expect heavy delays. 
  • Access to Eastern Distributor travelling south: motorists can access the Eastern Distributor via the Cross City Tunnel eastbound (toll-free from 5am – 3pm).

Managed local access:

  • Refinery Dr properties: managed entry and exit will be permitted via Tambua St from 4am-7am and 9am-9:30am under traffic control. Alternative parking for residents within road closures will be available at the Dragon Boat car park. Open from 2pm Sat 16 Sep until 12pm Sun 17 Sep.
  • The Star car park: from 4am-10am entry & exit via Edward St only. Access to the taxi rank/valet parking on Jones Bay Rd maintained via Pyrmont St.   
  • Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour & ibis Sydney Darling Harbour: access via Murray St south from Allen St. 
  • Darling Island Rd properties: Managed access available for Darling Island Rd properties until 6:30am only. Entry/exit via Pyrmont St and Jones Bay Rd.
  • Wharf 10 Pyrmont: Managed access until 6:30am via Pyrmont St, Jones Bay Rd and Pirrama Rd. 

THE ROCKS/ WALSH BAY/MILLERS POINT/BARANGAROO RESERVE

Key roads in Millers Point, The Rocks and Walsh Bay will be closed between 4am and 11am.  

  • From 4am to 8:30am: Lower Fort St, Argyle Place and Argyle St
  • From 4am to 10:30am: Hickson Rd closed from Napoleon St to Pottinger St.
  • From 4am to 11am: Hickson Rd/George St closed from Pottinger St down to Essex St.

Note, The Rocks Markets closures: George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St will be closed from 2pm Fri 15 Sept - 1am Mon 18 Sept

Managed local access:

  • Resident access for Merriman St, Bettington St and Rodens Ln will be via two-way traffic arrangements along Kent St only.
  • Resident access for Windmill St, Lower Fort St, Argyle Place and Trinity Ave will be via Cumberland St or Harrington St.  
  • There will be northbound access on Hickson Rd from 4am to 10:30am to Pottinger St or until 11am for access to The Rocks. Use Kent St or Clarence St.
  • Barangaroo Reserve Car Park maintains access via two-way traffic on Dalgety Rd and Kent St.

Milsons Point / North Sydney

Key roads around the event start area in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay, North Sydney, and Kirribilli will be closed between 3:30am and 11am including sections of Alfred St South, Olympic Dr, Fitzroy St, Lavender St and Broughton St.  

The Sydney Harbour Bridge, Cahill Expressway, and Western Distributor will be closed in both directions from 4am to 10am.

Southbound traffic approaching the Harbour Bridge will be diverted via the Harbour Tunnel. During this time there is no direct vehicle access to the CBD due to major closures in the city east. Residents that need to access the CBD before 10am are encouraged to catch trains instead for a more direct and faster route and avoid traffic delays on detour routes.

Motorists can access the Sydney Harbour Tunnel via the Neutral Bay Falcon St or Military Rd on-ramps. Heavy traffic is expected so motorists are strongly encouraged to delay non-essential travel until after 10am. After 10am use the Tunnel for access to the east/Airport or the Harbour Bridge for the CBD and west.

  • Managed local access Milsons Point: due to large crowds at the start area there is no vehicle access to properties on roads west of Alfred St South from 4am – 10am. Vehicles can continue to exit the area during this time via Cliff St and Lavender St westbound under traffic control.

KING ST WHARF / BARANGAROO SOUTH / COCKLE BAY WHARF

Key roads including Erskine St, Hickson Rd, Sussex St and Napoleon St will be closed between 4am and 8:30am.

Managed local access:

  • To King St Wharf, Cockle Bay Wharf and Barangaroo South: From 5am and 8:30am entry and exit via Wheat Rd, access from Harbour St. After 8:30am entry and exit via Erskine St.
  • Access to properties/car parks on Sussex St between Erskine St and King St will be available under traffic control during the road closures. Access via Kent St & Erskine St intersection only.
  • No northbound access on Hickson Rd between 4am and 10:30am. Use Kent St or Clarence St.

SYDNEY HOSPITAL

  • From 4am to 3pm – access to Sydney Hospital, and Hospital Rd will be two-way via Shakespeare Place only. Access via Sir John Young Cr or Palmer St. No access via St Marys Rd during this time.
  • Note: Local access to Cathedral St available via St Marys Rd from 4am to 3pm.
  • Vehicle crossover: Traffic will be able to cross the course east/west via Bent St and Shakespeare Place until 5am only. After this time, east/west access is via Cross City Tunnel only.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v West Tigers Double Header at Allianz Stadium. NRLW Kick-Off at 3:10pm, NRL Kick-Off at 5:30pm, Full Time around 7:30pm

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 2pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. Access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd. EP2 will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Southern Stars 'Embrace' will see more than 3000 students from across NSW perform at the WIN Entertainment Centre over two days, featuring vocalists, dancers and performers.

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists before, during and following each performance.

Both directions on Crown Street between Harbour Street and Marine Drive will be closed to allow for the safe dispersal of the children.

Evanescence concert at Qudos Bank Arena starting from 8pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Knights double header at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRLW kick-off at 1:50pm. NRL kick-off at 4:05pm and full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Melbourne FC at the SCG. First bounce at 3:20pm, finish 6pm approx. Post match concert from 6pm to 7pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and expect delays on key roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 8pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice: The Lake Macquarie Running Festival will be held in Warners Bay on Sunday 27 August 2023. The Esplanade from King Street to Park Road will be closed from 6am to 11am. A detour will be in place via Park Road, Main Road, Speers Street, Thomson Road, Ruswell Avenue, Medcalf Road and King Street. There will be increased pedestrian activity during the event. Please follow the direction of traffic control.

The Newcrest Orange Challenge is a bicycle ride event offering a 88km and 170km distance course. The event is expecting approximately 900 riders and covers four LGA's. The Mitchell Highway (Summer Street) will be closed to traffic between Peisley Street and Lords Place.
properties.diversions: Light vehicles will be detoured via Peisley Street, Byng Street and Lords Place. Heavy vehicles will be required to use the Northern Distributor Road.

properties.otherAdvice: The Newcrest Orange Challenge is a bicycle ride event offering a 88km and 170km distance course. The event is expecting an estimated 900 riders. The southbound lane of Canowindra Road at Canowindra will be closed between Cargo Road and Browns Avenue from 8:15am to 10:45am. Stop/slow flow management will be in place in the northbound lane.

properties.publicTransport: Route 155 services to and from Mona Vale will be diverting via Melbourne Avenue while roads are closed for the Beach2Beach fun run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Dee Why to Newport. Events start from 8am and will finish at around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do so after runners have safely passed by along the course.

  • Collaroy from 7am to 9:30am: Sections of Beach Road and Florence Avenue will be closed to general traffic.
  • Narrabeen from 7am to 9:30am: Narrabeen Beach SLSC car park will be closed on Ocean Street.
  • Warriewood/Mona Vale from 7.30am to 11am:
  • Narrabeen Park Parade southbound lanes will be closed between Cook Terrace and Sydney Road, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.
  • Sections of Melbourne Avenue, Basset Street, Orana Road and Surfview Road will be closed.
  • Peal Pl and Bruce St will be under managed access for residents via Narrabeen Park Pde northbound.
  • Mona Vale from 7.30am to 12pm: Grandview Parade will be closed between Orana Road and Barrenjoey Road.
  • Newport from 7.30am to 12:30pm: Sections of Ross Street, Palm Road and Myola Road around the Beach will be closed.

Southbound lane closures and a reduced speed limit of 40km/h will also be in place on sections of Barrenjoey Road while the event takes place.

A special event clearway will be in place from 4am to midday on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Road between Palm Road (Newport) and Grandview Parade (Mona Vale).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopen after cleaning  


COLLAROY – FROM 7AM TO 9.30AM

  • Beach Rd* between Anzac Ave and Collaroy Beach
  • Florence Ave* from Beach Rd

NARRABEEN – FROM 7AM TO 9.30AM

  • Ocean St loop Car Park between Albert St and King St (Narrabeen Beach SLSC)

WARRIEWOOD/MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 11AM

  • Bruce St and Pearl Pl will be under managed access from Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Melbourne Ave^^ between Cook Tce and Narrabeen Park Pde
  • Narrabeen Park Parade** between Cook Tce and Sydney Rd (south) (Southbound)
  • Bassett St* From Orana Rd (Eastbound)
  • Orana Rd^ between Bassett St and Grandview Pde (Northbound)
  • Surfview Rd* between Bassett St and Seabeach Ave
  • Surfview Rd* From Darley St E to end of street

MONA VALE – FROM 7:30AM TO 12PM

  • Grandview Pde^ between Barrenjoey Rd and Orana Rd (Eastbound)

NEWPORT – FROM 7:30AM TO 12.30PM

Restricted access is in place from Barrenjoey Rd northbound to Newport Beach and on the eastern side of Barrenjoey Rd between Karloo Parade and The Boulevarde. Residents are advised to expect minor delays.

  • Myola Rd* between Ross St and Palm Rd (Southbound)
  • Palm Rd* between Barrenjoey Rd and Myola Rd (Westbound)
  • Ross St* between Bramley Ave and Myola Rd (Northbound)

NOTES:

*Managed access for residents will be in place and minor delays expected.

^Resident will have access via Bassett St and should expect minor delays.

**Residents will have access via Narrabeen Park Parade in the northbound direction.

^^Route Buses excepted.

arrangementElements.html:
LANE CLOSURES – BARRENJOEY ROAD

Managed access for residents will be in place with minor delays expected. Temporary lane closures will be progressively reopen after cleaning.


NEWPORT TO MONA VALE

  • 6AM TO 11AM: Barrenjoey Rd between Hillcrest Ave and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 & 2 (Southbound)
  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between Palm Rd and Grandview Pde – Lane 1 (Southbound)


40KM/H SPEED REDUCTION – BARRENJOEY ROAD

﻿A reduced speed limit of 40km/h will apply in the following areas to ensure the safety of runners:

  • 6AM TO 12PM: Barrenjoey Rd between between The Boulevard and Grandview Pde (Southbound)

roads.mainStreet: Pittwater Road, Ocean Street and Barrenjoey Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Sea Eagles at Accor Stadium. NRL kick-off from 2pm, full-time around 4pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
Cat & Dog Lovers festival at Sydney Showground. Start 9.30am finish 5pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Traffic will be particularly busy on Sunday as an NRL match will also be held at Accor Stadium nearby.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Attendees driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road
